intro: Cacalia ehrenbergiana, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. It has heart-shaped leaves and is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils with minimal water requirements. Cacalia ehrenbergiana is often found in disturbed areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
